_header: With woeful heart plunged in distress
Subjects: lovers, addresses to beloved; lovers, absence/separation of
_description: Verses in which the poet bids farewell to his cruel mistress — eleven stanzas rhyme royal

BodRawC813.First Lines:
With woofull harte plungede yn dystresseI may well speke thes
                    wordes of woo…
BodRawC813.Last Lines:
…for yll wyll ys muche we nede no morethat I haue yow fautyd I
                    am Sorye therfore
BodRawC813.Editions:
Padelford,  Frederick Morgan. 
             “Liedersammlungen des xvi. Jahrhunderts…IV.” 
             Anglia
         31 (1908): 309-96: 354-6.
Jansen,  Sharon L.,  and  Kathleen H. Jordan, eds.  
             The Welles Anthology: MS. Rawlinson C.813: A Critical Edition.
         Binghamton, NY: Medieval & Renaissance Texts and Studies,
            1991: 181-4.
